titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: SGA Past Presidents
titleInfo.subTitle: Lloyd F. Love oral history interview, 1999-2000.

name.description: Lloyd F. Love was born in Monterey, La., in 1921 to Sadie White Love and James Hartwell Love. He had one brother, J.H. Love Jr. Love was valedictorian of his graduating class at Monterey High School and attended Louisiana State University from 1938 to 1942, earning a bachelor's degree in forestry. As an ROTC cadet, he was called to active duty in the U.S. Army Air Corps upon graduation. He earned his wings in August 1943 and flew 73 missions from Sardinia in a B-26 bomber. He served the remainder of the war flying out of Laughlin Field in Del Rio, Tex. After the war, Love intended to stay enlisted, but changed his mind after being set up on a blind date with Ann Jackson, whom he soon married. He started law school at LSU in late 1946 and served as Student Body President in 1946-1947. He received his LLB and JD degrees in 1948 and began practicing in Ferriday, La., that same year. Love dedicated much of his life to supporting LSU as member and 1959 president of the LSU Alumni Federation, a charter member of the LSU Foundation, and founder and past president of the Concordia Parish LSU Alumni Association. He successfully campaigned for construction of a ring levee in Concordia Parish, served as city attorney for the town of Ferriday, was active in the Rotary Club and Boy Scouts of America, and was recognized by the Louisiana Bar Association for his pro bono work. Love was the recipient of countless honors and awards for his military achievements, his work as a lawyer, his involvement with LSU, and his civic involvement in Concordia Parish and the state of Louisiana. He passed away in 2006 at age 84 and was survived by his wife and four children.

mods.abstract: Love recalls growing up in Monterey, La., on a 40-acre farm. He primarily discusses his time at LSU as an undergraduate (1938-1942) and law school student (1946-1948), going into detail about ROTC and cadet life, campus activities, athletics, women on campus, tuition and scholarships, student jobs, his term as LSU Student Body President, his friends and fellow students, and other topics. He discusses his military and pilot training and WWII service with the U.S. Army Air Corps from 1942 to 1945. He outlines his involvement with the LSU Alumni Federation, the LSU Foundation, and other university-related endeavors. He talks about Concordia Parish, La., and his campaign to have a levee built around the parish.
